result.execSummary:
The defendant Aquilar A Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aquilar A Evans

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aquilar A Evans in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  
Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Co. Ord. 63.01 to which defendant pled no contest.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $250.00 including all costs and surcharges by 1/23/23.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Aquilar A Evans in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aquilar A Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense advises the court they have discovery but no offer and asks the State to consider a DPA. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. 
Court orders matter adjourned back to Br. 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with OJS.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/16/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Aquilar A Evans in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Aquilar A Evans
Current: 3312 N 44th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 04-14-2022)
Prior: 9223 North 75th Street #5, Milwaukee, WI 53223
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/14/22 @ 1p
